speech.p: The House being met, the Clerk Assistant at the Table informed the House of the absence of Mr. SPEAKER from this day's Sitting:—
Whereupon Sir ERIC FLETCHER, The CHAIRMAN OF WAYS AND MEANS, proceeded to the Table and, after Prayers, took the Chair as DEPUTY SPEAKER, pursuant to the Standing Order.

Mr. Deputy Speaker, I beg to ask leave to present a Petition to this honourable House on behalf of the electors of Hemel Hempstead and others. The Petitioners pray that Her Majesty's Government will reinstate in the road programme bypasses to the towns of Hemel Hempstead, Berkhampsted, Tring and King's Langley, in view of the danger to human life. The Petition is signed by over 3,800 persons.
The Petition concludes:
Your Petitioners, as in duty bound, will ever pray.
To lie upon the Table.
